name: Upstream
headline: An email client designed for team collaboration
description: Upstream is an email client designed for team collaboration. We add features like channels and task-tracking functionality on top of a typical email client, so that teams can have full context and transparency on all of their conversations, and make decisions more efficiently.

founders.name: Louis Lecat, Founder
founders.description: I'm the founder & CEO @ Upstream. I was one of the early product people @ Asana, driving growth and adoption up to $100M ARR. I went on to lead the entire product team @ Algolia (YC W14) as their Head of Product through series B and C, assembling a team of 20+ talented product builders, while growing ARR 2.5x to $100M+. Also worked @ AgilOne (acquired) and graduated from @ Stanford and @ Ecole des Ponts

founders.name: Jonathan Tiret, Founder
founders.description: I am the co-founder & CTO @ Upstream. My love for software started when I was only a teenager: I developed @ Dino Gaia, one of the most popular online French consumer games in the 2000s, registering a million visits every month. I've since built extensive technical hands-on and leadership experience across multiple sectors, including ride-hailing, fintech, and legaltech. I was most recently the VP of Engineering @ Doctrine before it got acquired.

generated_description:
**Upstream: A New Era in Team Communication**

Founded in 2023, Upstream is shaking up how teams collaborate via email. Part of Y Combinator's Batch S23, this startup is small but mighty, operating with a lean team of just two. Their mission? To create an email client that's more than just an inbox—it's a centralized hub for collaboration that includes unique features like task tracking and organized conversations through channels and threads.

**Why Upstream?**

We all know email can become a chaotic mess. Upstream aims to cut through the noise, helping teams regain focus and efficiency. By structuring conversations into threads and channels, Upstream makes sure that important information doesn’t get lost in a sea of "reply all" emails. You can easily keep track of ongoing discussions and manage projects without feeling overwhelmed.

**Core Features**

1. **Structured Inbox**: Everything important in one place. The organized inbox presents key conversations clearly, so you’re always in the loop.
   
2. **Threads and Channels**: Keep discussions on track. No more random chit-chat that muddles critical information.
   
3. **Task Management**: Assign tasks with due dates, ensuring everyone knows who's responsible for what by when.
   
4. **Focus**: Opt into notifications that matter to you, helping mitigate the distractions that come with most messaging apps.

With Upstream, communication is streamlined, allowing teams to focus on what really matters—getting things done.

**Looking Ahead**

Located online at [Upstream.do](https://www.upstream.do/), this startup is backed by the formidable support of Y Combinator, a solid foundation for future growth. Whether you're looking for a more productive way to handle emails or want to enhance your team's collaborative efforts, Upstream is a promising tool aimed at reinventing modern team communication.

If you're intrigued, try getting started on your email transformation—you might just find that deep work isn’t as elusive as it seems.
